From: "Daniel Paul Hightower" <dph_of_rules@...>

1)For starters, now there is a way to check which scenarios you have 
visited.  Visit http://sluggy.net/glad/ and try it.  Thanks to the 
FSGames for providing a new resource.  If anybody wants any other 
features added to that, email the group.

2)Actually, now I feel free to say what I thought about membership.  
There are currently 65 members of this group.  I am planning on going 
through the membership list to find 1)invalid email addresses and 
2)people subscribed to this list who do not want to be.  Along the 
way, I plan on asking about interest in a tournament.

**Tournament related**

3)On the tournament, I am 100% against requiring one member teams.  I 
will have to rely on the honor system (plus deadlines) to keep 
would-be cheaters out.

I would have to have a few basic rules to make it easy to check on 
teams.  You send your initial saved game [before your team goes 
through any scenarios] to the judges of the tournament.  Every 5 or so 
scenarios, you send your saved game to the judges.  YOu would have 
something like 2-3 weeks to complete five scenarios and regardless of 
how many scenarios you have completed, you would send your file in.  
This would mean that every scenario in the tournament can be completed 
in 30 minutes or less with a beginning team.  Scenarios like my 
'Hedges', the stairs from tevfifty, the Labyrinth from the tevfifty 
could not be in the tournament without reducing the number of required 
scenarios to be completed with the allotted time.

To create the prize money [if we wanted prize money], I would suggest 
a small entry fee of $2-$5, with prizes for 1st, 2nd, and 3rd place.
